item.value: If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon. He, Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin and Michael Collins were the crew of Apollo 11.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan.
The blue whale can produce sounds up to 188 decibels. This is the loudest sound produced by a living animal and has been detected as far away as 530 miles.
China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.
In 1972 Ray Tomlinson at BBN developed the first e-mail program. In his first email to himself, he uses the @ sign. This was the first time it appeared in an e-mail address.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.

Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876. By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billions land lines in the world. China had more than 350 million phones, more than any other country.
